reviews.review_text: This is an absolute game changer. I've always been an avid believer that more expensive doesn't always mean better results, and have sworn by my Remington hair straightener for years. Turns out, I had been living in blissful ignorance, because after using this product regularly for the past month I know I can never go back to any other hair straightener. It also boasts a long cord that gives you space to reach the hard-to-get spots of your hair, while also leaving enough room at the bathroom mirror for your SO too.   Using it is incredibly simple too. There is only one heat setting, so just press the power button to turn it on. Less than a minute later it will indicate that it's ready for use. Now, with my old styler it would take me a minimum of two passes to get my hair perfectly straight. I chalked it up to the fact that I have long, thick hair that gets frizzy the moment someone so much as looks at it. With this styler my hair is done in one pass, and doesn't feel like I've burnt out all of the moisture either. My straightening time has decreased from over half an hour to 15 max, which is great for when I'm on the run or rushing to work.   I do see where there can be downsides though. For example, there is only one heat setting. For me, its the perfect heat. Though it may be too strong for those with thinner hair, or not strong enough to finish in one pass for those with curly hair. When purchasing a big ticket item like this, these things should be considered so that you know what you're getting yourself into in advance.   Bottom line, I'd absolutely recommend this product. Its sleek, efficient, and provides amazing results.

reviews.review_text: I tested the ghd original styler on my 2A/2B hair, slightly damp and with a heat-protectant cream.  The box is sturdy and feels nice, definitely great for gift-giving and can be used to store the styler.  You plug the styler then hold the power button for a second, which lights up and makes a little sound. After only about 4 seconds, a little tune notifies that the styler is hot, which really helps with avoiding accidental burns. And it actually heats up that fast!! There is an initial burnt metal smell, but it dissipated quickly and I havenu2019t smelled it since.   This styler is HOT. It felt like I was sitting next to a heater. But for me, the intense heat did make styling more efficient! I definitely recommend using a heat protectant and keeping an eye on how your hair reacts to this styler!!  My personal method of straightening hair with this styler is to do a smooth downward swipe (not hold) on a section of hair, let the hair cool just until it is just warm and not scorching (you can tell), then repeat as necessary until the settled hair is styled as desired.   I found that holding the styler in one place will end up creating an indent, but it was surprisingly easy to smooth it over with another quick swipe. Holding the styler is great for some styles, like waves, and the indenting is just something to keep in mind when straightening hair.  I was surprised at how smooth, no-frizz, and soft my hair actually was afterwards. The strands werenu2019t crunchy at all, and they even flowed weightlessly like in a commercial! This ghd original styler worked great for me. The design is easy to wield without accidentally touching skin or straining your hands, and it doesnu2019t produce a cheap chemical/burnt smell.   Overall, I very much like it! If you have been looking for a styler and are willing to splurge on a product that actually works, this is a product that follows through on hype.
